                    ### Question
                    Which of the following antitubercular drugs can be safely used in severe renal failure :

                    ### Options
                    opa. Streptomycin
opb. Ethambutol
opc. Capreomycin
opd. Rifampicin

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Rifampicin, primarily metabolized by the liver, is the safest antitubercular drug for use in severe renal failure. Ethambutol can be used with careful monitoring and dose adjustments. Streptomycin and Capreomycin, both primarily excreted by the kidneys, pose higher risks and are generally less suitable for patients with severe renal failure.
